basics.name: Shane Trimbur
basics.label: Solutions Architect -- Client Solutions -- Cybersecurity Engineering
basics.summary: Veteran technology strategist with extensive DoD enterprise expertise spanning two decades. Proven ability to build and guide diverse teams while establishing forward-looking capabilities that exceed targets. Employs insider knowledge as a Marine technical leader versed in delivering innovative solutions that meet complex government needs. Leverages deep defense sector expertise to transform mission requirements into enterprise-ready architectures.

work.name: 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing
work.position: Data Systems Engineering Officer -- Information Systems Security Engineer
work.summary: Leading enterprise cloud adoption and data fusion initiatives for MARFORPAC and 3rd MAW.
highlights: Faced with outdated cloud infrastructure that hindered global operations, I spearheaded an enterprise cloud adoption initiative impacting MARFORPAC and 3rd MAW. By implementing a cutting-edge multi-cloud architecture through the Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability program, I enhanced DoD mission capabilities.
responsibilities: Implementing experimental multi-cloud architecture through the Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability program
Integrating Naval Research Labs with partner agencies for real-time environmental intelligence sharing
achievements: Faced with outdated and siloed systems that hindered data driven mission planning, I spearheaded an enterprise cloud adoption initiative impacting MARFORPAC and 3rd MAW. By implementing a cutting-edge multi-cloud architecture through the Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability program, I enhanced DoD mission capabilities.

work.name: Marine Wing Communications Squadron 38
work.position: Data Systems Engineering Officer -- Information Systems Security Engineer

highlights: Led systems engineering activities toward award-winning JADC2 transformation initiative
Modernized tactical infrastructure supporting 20,000+ joint force personnel
Supervised integration of advanced network systems during Project Convergence
responsibilities: Lead systems engineering and transformation initiatives for JADC2 implementation
Oversee tactical infrastructure modernization for joint force operations
Direct integration of advanced network systems and emerging technologies
Manage cross-functional teams and coordinate with multiple stakeholders
achievements: Led systems engineering activities toward award-winning JADC2 transformation initiative that earned both the 2022 Shea Award and DON IT Excellence Award
Modernized tactical infrastructure supporting 20,000+ joint force personnel, implementing resilient architecture
Supervised integration of advanced network systems during Project Convergence, significantly reducing sensor-to-shooter timelines

work.name: Marine Corps Communications-Electronics School
work.summary: Led IT portfolio management, IT personnel development, and educational technology transformation initiatives.
highlights: Aging IT infrastructure and compliance gaps threatened training requirements needed for Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) certification. I directed a $9M+ portfolio modernization program that achieved and maintained 100% NIST/CNSS compliance while upgrading critical systems.
Lead and mentored a diverse team of 10 Marines, 3 senior GS employees, and 3 contractors, fostering technical proficiency and professional development.
Transformed educational delivery through comprehensive redesign of campus wireless architecture and business strategy, significantly enhancing accessibility and connectivity.
Directed $27M in technology modernization initiatives over three years, expanding network infrastructure and increasing educational accessibility by 40% for over 30,000 students.
responsibilities: Oversee comprehensive IT portfolio and compliance programs, aligning technical initiatives with mission objectives.
Lead cross-functional teams of military, civilian, and contractor personnel, ensuring seamless collaboration and execution of strategic initiatives.
Implement large-scale infrastructure improvements to enhance cybersecurity, connectivity, and operational efficiency.
achievements: Aging IT infrastructure and compliance gaps threatened training requirements needed for Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) certification. I directed a $9M+ portfolio modernization program that achieved and maintained 100% NIST/CNSS compliance while upgrading critical systems.

Contracting and installation of comprehensive Campus WiFi and network infrastructure was a complex undertaking that required coordinated leadership across diverse teams. I led and mentored an integrated team of 10 Marines, 3 senior GS employees, and 3 contractors, resulting in improved cross-functional collaboration and technical delivery. I also coordinated all aspects of the project, including design, installation, and integration of the new infrastructure.

Inconsistent and rigidly defined performance standards hindered team development and mission execution. I designed and implemented a comprehensive performance management system that standardized evaluations and enhanced professional development for both civilian and military personnel.

work.name: Special Purpose Marine Air Ground Task Force Crisis Response-Central Command
work.summary: Led multi-site cybersecurity operations in forward-deployed environments, collaborating with intelligence stakeholders to develop security policies and manage incident responses, ensuring the protection of Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) and safeguarding mission-critical data and personnel.
highlights: Directed complex multi-site cybersecurity operations, maintaining zero security compromises in high-risk areas.
Developed and implemented comprehensive cybersecurity policies to enhance compliance and mitigate risks.
Engineered advanced threat detection systems and data loss prevention tools, ensuring real-time response to emerging threats.
Led incident response operations for security breaches and classified data spillages, preventing potential threats to mission success and personnel safety.
responsibilities: Manage cybersecurity operations across multiple forward operating bases, ensuring continuous protection of mission-critical assets.
Develop and enforce cybersecurity policies to maintain compliance and operational security standards.
Implement and maintain advanced security systems to detect, mitigate, and respond to cyber threats.
Lead incident response efforts for security breaches and classified data spillages, minimizing operational risks and ensuring rapid containment.
achievements: As the principal action officer for security incidents, I led the response to frequent data spillages and security breaches threatening our mission-critical information. I coordinated comprehensive investigations with local system administrators and network contractors, meticulously documenting findings to satisfy reporting requirements across MARCENT, CENTCOM, and Headquarters Marine Corps. Recognizing the need for a proactive approach, I authored and implemented enhanced security policies that maintained tactical flexibility while ensuring robust data protection. This strategic intervention eliminated all further security incidents for the duration of my deployment, safeguarding operational integrity in a high-stakes environment.

Hostile environments and distributed operations posed critical security risks. I directed complex multi-site cybersecurity operations across three countries, achieving zero security compromises throughout deployment.

Advanced persistent threats required enhanced detection capabilities. I engineered and implemented sophisticated threat detection systems and data loss prevention tools, resulting in 100% threat identification and mitigation.

work.name: 1st Marine Logistics Group
work.summary: Led cybersecurity operations and network security initiatives in collaboration with key defense partners.
highlights: Coordinated joint cybersecurity operations with USN Cyber Protection Team, implementing Security Onion suite for enhanced network visibility
Leveraged Zeek (formerly Bro) for sophisticated deep packet inspection and network traffic analysis, significantly improving threat detection capabilities
Collaborated with Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory to evaluate advanced network behavior analytics and anomaly detection systems
responsibilities: Lead joint cybersecurity operations with Navy partners
Implement and manage advanced network monitoring systems
Evaluate and deploy cutting-edge security analytics solutions
achievements: Limited network visibility hampered threat detection capabilities. I coordinated with USN Cyber Protection Team to implement Security Onion suite, dramatically enhancing network monitoring effectiveness.

Complex network traffic patterns obscured potential threats. I deployed Zeek for sophisticated deep packet inspection, enabling real-time threat detection and significantly improving security posture.

Traditional security tools struggled with emerging threats. I partnered with Johns Hopkins APL to evaluate and implement advanced network behavior analytics, revolutionizing our anomaly detection capabilities.

work.name: Marine Corps Communications-Electronics School
work.summary: Delivered over 1,200 hours of technical instruction to military personnel, honing expertise in public speaking and adapting complex concepts to diverse audiences.
highlights: Developed comprehensive DoD-aligned cybersecurity curriculum, incorporating emerging threats and defense strategies
Delivered advanced technical instruction to 200+ students in enterprise security tools, vulnerability management, and network defense
Established rigorous evaluation frameworks ensuring training materials maintain relevance against sophisticated cyber threats and align with DoD cybersecurity requirements
responsibilities: Develop and maintain cybersecurity curriculum
Provide technical instruction in enterprise security
Create and implement training evaluation frameworks
achievements: Faced with an outdated curriculum that failed to address emerging cyber threats, I was tasked with overhauling the training program. I Developed a comprehensive, DoD-aligned cybersecurity curriculum integrating emerging threats and modern defense strategies. This enhanced training effectiveness and improved cyber workforce production.

With 200+ students needing advanced skills in cybersecurity, I was responsible for elevating their technical proficiency. I delivered in-depth instruction on enterprise security tools, vulnerability management, and network defense. These efforts significantly increased student competency and preparedness for real-world challenges.

Recognizing that rapid cyber threat evolution rendered training materials obsolete, I was assigned to ensure curriculum modernization. I chaired course content review boards to systematically update and align materials with current cyber threats. This maintained curriculum relevance and boosted overall training efficacy.

work.name: 2nd Battalion, 23rd Marine Regiment
work.position: Information Systems Coordinator | Webmaster | Mobile Device Mgmt.
work.summary: Led international communications coordination and infrastructure management.
highlights: Led C2 integration efforts for SOUTHCOM and UNITAS, successfully coordinating communications across 9 partner nations during complex amphibious operations
Established critical communications infrastructure for NATO operations in Estonia (BALTOPS), ensuring seamless multinational coordination
Managed $1.5M enterprise infrastructure portfolio supporting global military exercises with zero mission-critical failures
responsibilities: Coordinate multinational communications operations
Manage enterprise infrastructure portfolio
Lead NATO communications initiatives
achievements: During the UNITAS multinational exercise, I encountered severe communication barriers threatening coordinated operations across 9 partner nations. Tasked with enabling seamless C2 integration, I methodically analyzed each system's compatibility issues and developed a comprehensive integration framework. By systematically implementing cross-platform solutions and establishing standardized protocols, I transformed the previously fragmented systems into a cohesive network. This integration enabled flawless coordination throughout complex amphibious operations, significantly enhancing multinational interoperability and establishing a new standard for future joint exercises.

When confronted with critical NATO communication vulnerabilities in Estonia during BALTOPS preparations, I recognized the urgent need for a robust infrastructure to support allied operations. I conducted a thorough assessment of existing tactical systems and identified key integration points to create a unified communication network. Through careful implementation of compatibility solutions and redundant pathways, I converted these disconnected systems into a seamless communication infrastructure. The resulting network eliminated previous vulnerabilities and ensured uninterrupted multinational coordination throughout the exercise, strengthening NATO's operational capabilities in this strategically significant region.

Upon inheriting a troubled $1.5M enterprise infrastructure portfolio supporting global military exercises, I discovered numerous critical vulnerabilities threatening mission success. I immediately initiated a comprehensive risk assessment to identify failure points and developed a strategic revitalization plan. By implementing systematic maintenance protocols, building in redundancy systems, and training support personnel, I transformed the reliability of these essential systems. My proactive approach eliminated all previous failure patterns and achieved zero mission-critical outages across operations worldwide, ensuring continuous support for vital military exercises and protecting this significant organizational investment.

work.name: 2nd Marine Division
work.summary: Managed mission-critical systems and communications infrastructure.
highlights: Integrated and maintained 8+ mission-critical systems for RCT Command Post infrastructure, ensuring 99.9% uptime
Engineered robust enterprise communications architecture supporting MEF-level exercises involving thousands of personnel
Supervised operational continuity across multiple Battalion Operations Centers in high-tempo environments
responsibilities: Maintain mission-critical systems
Engineer communications architecture
Supervise installation, operation, and maintenance of Battalion Operations Centers
achievements: Faced with maintenance, equipment shortfalls, and reliability challenges in the Combat Operations Centers throughout the division, I integrated and maintained 8+ mission-critical systems, achieving a 99.9% uptime and ensuring dependable operational performance.
Confronted with communication gaps during large-scale MEF-level exercises, I engineered a resilient enterprise communications architecture that seamlessly supported thousands of personnel.

When high-tempo environments threatened operational continuity, I supervised and coordinated multiple Battalion Operations Centers, ensuring uninterrupted command and control during critical missions.
